do we study them in the laboratory, other than their physical
effects?
The various forms of effective energy medicine such as
acupuncture, homeopathy, cranial osteopathy (and others) are not
understood by orthodox medicine and, for that reason, are generally dismissed and usually opposed. It is not sufficient to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> that
acupuncture works; or that most <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> are intuitive. If you can't
explain it, then modern <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> <span class="t1 t7 t9 t14 t15 t17 t25 t28 hoverable">says</span> it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> be bogus. We are not
talking about religion, beliefs or values, but about <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">things</span> that actually happen on a nonmaterial level.
Earlier cultures acknowledged the tremendous <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of immaterial life-energies. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> force (Ch'i) that moves along the energy
meridians in the <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> was recognized by the Chinese several thousand <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t22 t23 t28 hoverable">years</span> ago. To correct bioenergetic imbalances or
blockages in the body, they developed acupuncture at that time, a
treatment still widely <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> in China and now <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">many</span> Western
countries by accredited practitioners and by some more openminded physicians.
While the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> sciences, for the most part, are still imprisoned in
the mechanistic view of life, the physical sciences are undergoing a
revolution. The study of sub-atomic phenomena has led to the
development of quantum physics, in which the environment
becomes unpredictable. The boundaries between energy and matter <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> blurred, so that the smallest constituents of matter —
particles and electrons — are interchangeable. Matter becomes
energy, which leads to the conclusion that everything is energy.2
Sadly the rigid boundaries that have developed between <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span>
scientific disciplines have as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> denied these insights to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> sciences and to medicine.
As there is nowhere intellectually respectable to slot in these
'anomalous' phenomena, <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> labels have to be found, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> 'energy
medicine' or 'alternative science.' Schauberger was a pioneer of
alternative science, which pushes the boundaries of what is worthy
of study beyond the merely physical.

Degrees of energy
We <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">know</span> the ways in which energy manifests itself. We can <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> that
flowing <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> is energetic. We can <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> that energy is associated with
creating clouds. Energy is active in an engine combusting gasoline
2. <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">DIFFERENT</span> KINDS OF ENERGY

or petrol. But what is its essence, a process that always seems to be
connected with movement?
When we look up at the fluffy clouds on a summer's day, we
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> wonder what they're <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">made</span> of. So wispy and light, each cloud
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> contain hundreds or thousands of tons of tiny individual
droplets of water, invisible and in constant motion. A collection
of minute, invisible, weightless <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">things</span> becomes large and visible.
It's a question of density. Our entire universe forms in the same
way.
A material object consists of billions of atoms, each composed
of sub-atomic particles, each of which is a vortex of energy.
Gyrating around each other in vortices, the sub-atomic particles
<span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> heavier particles of energy that <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> denser, eventually
slowing down to the point where they <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> visible or <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span>
tangible.
<span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Water</span> is a substance that appears in <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> forms <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t19 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">according</span> to
its compactness. In its solid state, as ice, its atomic particles move
the most slowly. As the ice melts, they move faster, need more space
to gyrate or vibrate, creating the less dense form, liquid water.
Heated up, the particles accelerate, requiring more space, and
<span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> steam or the invisible gas, <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> vapour. Their state and
appearance differ, depending on their expression of energy as
movement or vibration, and its rate of motion is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> its frequency. The principles of vibration and frequency determine the
countless energy forms in our world.
The material substance we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> is the result of energy setting
up a visible 'blur' by vibrating in and out of a physical state, with
a frequency and density that makes it seem <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> a static whole.
The forms create an illusion of being solid and static, caused by
countless particles constantly accelerating and then slowing
down enough for us to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> them as matter. When you <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> that all
material objects are composed of atoms and particles in constant
motion, it becomes possible to understand that everything is
energy.

The vortex as the key to creative evolution
The vortex is a window between <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> qualities or levels of
energy. Black Holes can be <span class="t0 t5 t6 t14 t18 hoverable">thought</span> of as vortices linking <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> parts of our universe or <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> universes. The vortex
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

and spiral became hallmarks for Viktor Schauberger, as for him
they were the key to all creative movement. As we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> demonstrate later, the vortex is most clearly seen with water, which it
uses to purify and energize itself, introducing finer energies to
wipe clean the bad energies of the water's previous memory of
misuse.
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> use the metaphor of a musty room that feels stale
and unwelcoming. Once sunlight and fresh air are allowed to penetrate, the unpleasant atmosphere is quickly transformed. It is a
natural <span class="t0 t8 t12 t15 t19 t23 t25 hoverable">law</span> that the more refined energy always prevails over the
coarser.3 As Viktor Schauberger demonstrated, Nature's evolutionary imperative is continually to refine and to create greater
complexity and diversity, the vortex being the key process in this
endeavour.

Energies as creative process
We normally think of energy as the <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> to do work, as to be able
to run across a busy street. But <span class="t0 t5 t6 t14 t18 hoverable">thought</span> is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> energy. For the
human, creativity is dependent on thought. Between having an idea
and our wish to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> it fulfilled lies a complex creative process.
If I want to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span> an apple pie, there is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> the idea, then the
planning, translating this through visualization and then finally
the physical <span class="t14 hoverable">creation</span> of the pie. This is <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> more important
than we realize. From the simplest task <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> tying your shoelace,
to the complex challenge of becoming a tennis champion, the better the 'mind pictures' of how we are going to perform the
required actions, the more successful will be the outcome. The
force, the impulse, which is the motivator for us to create, is an
unseen energetic process.
Viktor Schauberger shows us that we need to think of energy in
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> as the potential for creation, not as a mechanical working
process. He criticized our present view of how <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> <span class="t9 t16 t26 hoverable">works</span> as
untenably mechanistic, which he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">said</span> this is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> of the main reasons why we're in such a mess. Our culture thinks of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> as being
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> a big machine that can be manipulated and its resources
extracted for our own greed, rather than a creative system that has
a purpose.
Productive energies <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span> it possible for <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> forms to arise that
are appropriate to the needs of the environment. It is as if <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span>
2. <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">DIFFERENT</span> KINDS OF ENERGY

has a blueprint for what is required for a balanced and diversified
community. For example, a healthy river that is carrying energized
<span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> will create on its banks trees that it needs to keep it cool and
protect its vitality.
James Lovelock and Lynn Margulis recognized this creativity by
naming the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> 'Gaia' after the classical <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> goddess. They
described how the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> behaves <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> an organism, and how the
conditions for <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> on our planet are maintained <span class="t5 t7 hoverable">within</span> very narrow
limits, in spite of the enormous variation in the Sun's radiation, and
the effect of harmful cosmic rays. This seems to <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t7 t10 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> in a similar
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> to the self-regulating system in the <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> that maintains
the blood temperature in the narrow range essential for health
(around +37°C/98.4°F). A mechanistic scientist <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> insist that
this is just a computer function, but computers don't operate with
purpose and meaning.

<span class="t7 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">Spiritual</span> science
To <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">say</span> that purpose and <span class="t6 t13 t14 t25 t27 hoverable">meaning</span> are more to do with belief or
religion is, I believe, a mistaken view. Purpose can be ascribed to
living systems. Watch a community of bees at work, and there is
a significant purpose! <span class="t6 t13 t14 t25 t27 hoverable">Meaning</span> is usually associated with sentient beings. Being creatively <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> is difficult <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> a sense
of <span class="t6 t13 t14 t25 t27 hoverable">meaning</span> in one's life. Schauberger didn't talk <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> about God,
but as we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> he recognized in the extraordinary fecundity
of Nature, and indeed in all of her processes, an indisputable
sense of <span class="t6 t13 t14 t25 t27 hoverable">meaning</span> and purpose. If it makes more sense to you, call
it 'spiritual' science.
It is not necessary to postulate a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> that created <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">every</span> living
thing and who is behind all the subtle energies in Nature. Probably the idea, <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> in so <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">many</span> religions, of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> as a being <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span>
superman <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whose</span> support can be <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> on for your little or big
<span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> plays is in <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> the same category as that of regarding
Earth's resources as private property for exploitation. The concept
of co-creation — that all of <span class="t14 hoverable">creation</span> participates in and contributes to the creative process, is often more acceptable to the
thoughtful searcher.
We are clearly influenced by the beliefs of the culture into which
we are born. The worldview of contemporary Western society represents an enormous shift <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">away</span> from what has been the norm of
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

human experience over its half million or so <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t22 t23 t28 hoverable">years</span> on the Earth. The
clearest modern examples of a more 'normal' worldview are the
Buddhist beliefs, the Celtic, and those of the indigenous peoples
worldwide who share the idea that the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Great</span> <span class="t0 t1 t3 t5 t7 t8 t13 t16 t18 t20 t21 t25 t27 t29 hoverable">Spirit</span> (or God) inspires
and inhabits the rocks, the waters, and all living things.
In our detachment from the complete or 'real' world, we assume
that it is normal to divide <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> 'bits' of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> into separate
compartments or 'disciplines.' In fact it is quite abnormal. For traditional peoples, there are no barriers between cosmology, science
and the spiritual, for in the interconnectedness of all <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> there is
no separation; all is One.

<span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">Different</span> dimensions
Viktor Schauberger didn't write about hierarchies of energy, but we
<span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">know</span> that he subscribed to Theosophical or Eastern concepts of
energies, so we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">give</span> an outline of these in <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> to understand
where he was coming from.
Our physical spacetime dimension contains that spectrum of
energy that vibrates at a rate low enough to support material form.
This Third Dimension or domain has length, breadth and height,
but it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> has the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> components by which humans <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> be conscious. These are: the physical, neutral energy through which the
material <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> exists; the emotional, negative energy by which we
receive sensory information; and the mental, positive energy by
which we project our beliefs and personalities into the world. (NB:
The terms negative and positive are <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> not in a qualitative sense,
but more in the electrical sense of polarity.)
Our daily lives demonstrate the differences between these energies. The mental is the most changeable; it is harder to change our
feelings, and the dense, physical <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> is almost impossible to
change. If we move into a lower dimension, we lose <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> aspect of
consciousness, and if we move higher, we gain one. Moving from the
third to the <span class="t6 hoverable">second</span> dimension, we lose the ability to generate original thought. Moving from the third to the fourth, we add the ability
to mould time.4
In terms of the pure physicality of our three-dimensional world,
our consciousness places and senses each lower dimension as being
external to the body, although, paradoxically, it is both <span class="t5 t7 hoverable">within</span> and
without, and permeated by the higher <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> (see Fig. 2.1, next page).5

Intuitive or inspired creativity, the level of expanded consciousness sometimes reached by inventors or by <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>
vision, belongs to the fifth and sixth dimensions. It is apparent
that Viktor Schauberger had the ability to tap into this reservoir of
inspiration. All subtle dimensions are present on Earth, interpenetrating the third dimension, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> we are not normally conscious of them.6 The other animals or humans with raised
consciousness have a wider range of perception. A close relationship with a dog, cat or horse often reveals instances where the animal is aware of a nonphysical 'presence' which is beyond our own
awareness or which <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> be a <span class="t0 t1 t3 t5 t7 t8 t13 t16 t18 t20 t21 t25 t27 t29 hoverable">spirit</span> presence. If we lower our consciousness, we feel less ability to control our own lives. If all our
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> components of consciousness are being fully used, then we
can experience the full potential of being human, which is the gift
of free will.
We <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> not discuss in detail here the important energy shifts
that are occurring on our planet at this time. In line with the idea
that God, or the All-That-Is, seeks constant evolution or expansion
of consciousness, ancient teaching has <span class="t1 t6 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> predicted that the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> and all its inhabitants <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> graduate from the third to the

fourth dimension in these times. <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Human</span> society is becoming

control, and those who wish to participate in a fairer and more

Changing octaves
When Viktor Schauberger said,'We <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> think an octave higher,' (if
we are to get out of this mess), <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> tends to think he <span class="t1 t2 t3 t6 t7 t9 t13 t14 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">means</span> being
less <span class="t19 hoverable">taken</span> in by the physical view of life, and <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> more aware of
its subtle aspects. While that is true, he did propose an interesting
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> of illustrating the concept of how a particular kind of energy
can be <span class="t19 hoverable">taken</span> up <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> octave. On the face of it, the following <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> be
considered contradictory, but a more interesting view is to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> them
as complementary or reciprocal energies an octave apart, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> a
development of the other (like thesis and antithesis), which, when
combined are reconciled and <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> a unity:8

The <span class="t6 hoverable">second</span> column, the 'antitheses,' being more refined, have the
potential to contribute to creative evolution by being able to bridge
the gap between the idea and manifestation. They are, if you like,
endowed with special vibrational energies and powers.
Callum Coats, in translating some of these more difficult concepts
from Viktor's German terms, coined his own to describe the <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span>
forms of subtle energies from the fourth and fifth dimensions, which

higher, bipolar subtle energy. In the summer months the solar energies fuse with their female opposites in the higher strata near the

Viktor grouped almost all the <span class="t6 t10 t15 hoverable">known</span> elements and their compounds, with the exception of oxygen and hydrogen, under the general classification of 'female.' The exceptions were silver, zinc and
silicon, which were considered to have paternally-oriented characteristics, while gold, copper and limestone were regarded as more
maternal (these will be discussed in more detail in <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span> 17).
Schauberger <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> the term 'carbones' for all these elements, (the
extra 'e' <span class="t6 t13 t14 t25 t27 hoverable">meaning</span> more than just 'carbon'), because of the prevalence
of various sorts of carbonous matter in the multitude of living
organisms created in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of Mother Earth.
The Sun's energy, of course, is regarded as male, and Viktor saw
oxygen as a lower <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of solar energy. Together, the role of the <span class="t0 t8 t11 t14 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">Sun</span>
and its assistant oxygen is to fertilize these female, propagative
energies, the <span class="t0 t8 t11 t14 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">Sun</span> being responsible for all of life, and oxygen for
organic growth and development. To hydrogen, Viktor gave a special role, as the carrier substance of both oxygen and carbone (see
Fig. 3.2 above). From a detached view, <span class="t6 t9 t18 t26 hoverable">far</span> outside the atmosphere,
our planet, composed of carbones and fertilized by oxygen, is
indeed floating in the hydrogen gas ocean of space.
The <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">words</span> 'matter' and 'material,' both have their root in the
Latin <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">word</span> mater, <span class="t6 t13 t14 t25 t27 hoverable">meaning</span> mother, which supports the idea that
physical substance is feminine in nature. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> all the physical elements (except for oxygen and hydrogen) can be seen as the maternal progenitive constituents of 'Mother-Earth.' Viktor Schauberger
visualized all physical structures and all <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> living entities coming
into being through the union between these 'mother-substances'
and the inseminating agent of oxygen.

Polarities
Viktor Schauberger <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> to call polarity Nature's engine. He once
described the harmonious interplay of the attraction and repulsion
of polarized atoms as 'the dance of creation.' Electricity depends on
the positive and negative charge of electrons. Magnetism expresses
the polarities of attraction and repulsion. Polarities <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> apply in
biological terms, of course, where balance is achieved between contrasting qualities, and of course between <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> sexes.

Without the attraction and repulsion of atoms there <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be no
water, no plants, nor chemical compounds. The mutual attraction of
2 x H and 1 x O gives birth to the marvel of water.
We are more familiar with the terms 'positive' and 'negative' than
'male' and 'female' in scientific contexts; as, for example, with electricity. Of course, positive and negative in this sense are not judgmental terms, but opposite poles. Schauberger felt that to use the
terms masculine and feminine was more in keeping with Nature,
which he saw as a living organic system.

Opposites working towards balance
We tend to think of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> as being chaotic. The reverse is true.
Schauberger discovered that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> operates <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t19 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">according</span> to very
strict laws. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> of the most important is that concerned with the
balance between energy polarities, each of which has its particular
manner of expression. Masculine and feminine <span class="t16 t21 hoverable">together</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span> up a
complete <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> being; <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">cannot</span> exist <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> the other, and
each needs the other to be whole. You <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t18 t21 t22 t23 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">might</span> think that to be in balance, masculine and feminine energies need to be about 50/50, as
they nearly are with the distribution of the <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> sexes.
For the last <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> thousand <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t22 t23 t28 hoverable">years</span> or so <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> society has functioned in a predominantly masculine mode and is now quite out of
balance. If you consider masculine energy to be represented by
rationality, concern with the physical, forceful, expansive and individualistic; and the feminine by a tendency to be inclusive, intuitive,
connecting and compassionate — then most will agree we need a
swing of the pendulum towards the latter.
The natural <span class="t0 t8 t12 t15 t19 t23 t25 hoverable">law</span> about balance is that it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> be weighted
towards the feminine for creative growth to proceed. Otherwise
growth (in terms of higher quality) is arrested, and degeneration
takes place. This applies to all the qualities, like:
matter and energy or <span class="t0 t1 t3 t5 t7 t8 t13 t16 t18 t20 t21 t25 t27 t29 hoverable">spirit</span>
chaos and <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span>
yang and yin
positive and negative (not in judgmental terms, more electrical)
egoism and altruism
quantity and quality (a confusion of our present society)

What is the correct proportion by which the negative should dominate? Ancient Chinese society was very <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> <span class="t19 hoverable">taken</span> up with these
questions, and they believed the ratio of the correct balance was
three-fifths (60%) to two-fifths (40%). Viktor Schauberger, who
worked very intuitively, particularly on the temperature gradients
in water, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">came</span> up with two-thirds to one-third (66.7%). Callum
Coats, who worked with Viktor's <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">son</span> Walter, a mathematician and
physicist, related the proportion to the sacred geometric ratio of
(phi) which is 1.618, which gives the negative share of 61.8%.
The interaction and combination of opposites is <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> throughout all natural processes. It is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> of heat and cold. The crucial
interplay of heat and cold is <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">many</span> life-forms. Some types
of fruit and seeds <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">cannot</span> germinate properly unless they have been
exposed to frost. Brussels sprouts are best after the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> frost!
Growth is dependent on the <span class="t27 hoverable">right</span> combination of heat and cold.
There is, however, no such thing as stable equilibrium, which
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> <span class="t22 hoverable">bring</span> immobility and uniformity with which evolution
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be impossible. Development and evolution in the dynamic
Universe depend on an inherent imbalance, since movement is
always occurring somewhere between <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> extreme and the other.

Gravity and levity
Gravity is recognized as a powerful physical force in the Cosmos.
However, Viktor Schauberger demonstrated that its opposite, levity,
is tremendously important in Nature. That levity is not acknowledged by conventional science presumably has to do with its being

Levitation can best
be described as the life-force present in all healthy living things,
particularly the more youthful, which gives a feeling of lightness
and of relative weightlessness. It gradually weakens with age, so that

The essence of the Gaia principle is that all <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> is interconnected.

When you <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">say</span> someone has

chanting, bees humming.
Resonance is the language of communication and response. It is
how energetic information is transferred from <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> object to
another. It is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> the mechanism of harmony. For example, the
organs and cells in the <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> vibrate each at its specific frequency, and in the healthy <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> they resonate in harmony <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> the
<span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> instruments of an orchestra. Water, as the principal constituent of and the bringer of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> to all organisms, is the most powerful carrier of resonance.

Sound as resonance
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Every</span> musician knows that a tuning fork of the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t9 t12 t14 t15 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">note</span> C struck in a
concert hall will <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span> any number of C tuning forks respond in the
same space. When you rub your finger round the rim of a wine
glass, its <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t9 t12 t14 t15 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">note</span> will sound. If a singer finds this note, the glass will
resonate in sympathy, or <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> shatter if the vibration becomes too
strong.
Sound is probably the most ancient <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of resonance in the
<span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> experience. Jericho was reputedly destroyed by destructive
sound resonances. There are accounts in oral traditions of how early
societies, such as the ancient Egyptian, the Tibetan and the Inca
employed the use of sound to levitate enormous blocks of stone
<span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> in their buildings. Music itself is more than a paradigm of
Nature's resonances. For millennia <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> have sung and played
music to their crops, their lovers and their children. Schauberger

describes how the Alpine farmers while stirring the fertilizing liquid <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> sing into it (see p. 230).
Callum Coats cites:
Research carried out by Dr John Diamond in the field of
behavioral kinesiology (BK), yields some interesting
insights.1 A member of the International Academy of Preventive Medicine, Dr Diamond <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> that while the deltoid muscle of a healthy adult male can normally resist a force of
40-45lbs, its strength is reduced to 10—15lbs through the
negative effect of <span class="t3 hoverable">certain</span> types of rock music, such as heavy
metal and hard rock.2
In contrast to a more natural rhythm, where the beat
emulates that of the heart, with emphasis on the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> beat,
i.e. DA-da-da or 'LUB dup rest,' as he puts it, in the above
type of music this emphasis is reversed, i.e. da-da-DA, which
conflicts with the body's natural pulsation and in poetry is
<span class="t6 t10 t15 hoverable">known</span> as an 'anapestic beat.' As Dr.Diamond states: 'one of
the characteristics of the anapestic beat is that it is stopped
at the <span class="t7 t10 t15 t25 hoverable">end</span> of each bar or measure. Rock music that has this
weakening effect appears to have this stopped quality; it is as
if the music stops and then has to start again, and the
listener subconsciously "comes to a halt" at the <span class="t7 t10 t15 t25 hoverable">end</span> of each
measure. The anapestic beat is the opposite of the dactylic or
waltz <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> beat, which is DA-da-da, and in which there is an
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> flow.'3
Dr Diamond further asserts that:
these forms of music and unnatural rhythms <span class="t1 t3 t9 t15 t20 t21 t26 t29 hoverable">cause</span> switching
in the brain's responses, which induces 'subtle perceptual difficulties' that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t8 t10 t12 t13 t14 t17 t19 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">well</span> manifest themselves in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t22 t23 t24 t26 t29 hoverable">children</span> as
decreased performance in school, hyperactivity and restlessness; in adults as decreased <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t7 t10 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> output, increased errors,
general inefficiency, reduced decision-making capacity on the
job,... in short, the loss of energy, for no apparent reason.

Resonance is about qualities
As we saw in <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span> 2, all matter, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> look solid and
stationary, is based on sub-atomic particles that are always in
motion.4 The velocity of this motion determines its vibratory rate;
this and the type and size of the object contribute to its vibrational
frequency. A piece of wood, and each of the organs in our bodies
have <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> resonant frequencies; planet <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> has its own — a
frequency of 7.83Hz (Hertz). <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Every</span> thing, both animate and
apparently inanimate has its own vibrational or resonant frequency that can be enhanced by sympathetic vibrations, or
harmed by destructive.

A very tragic example of this was publicized by the media in the
summer of 2001.5 The navies of several countries, notably the US
and Britain, have developed sonar technology for hunting submarines. This involves using massive blasts of sound up to 230 decibels which have been blamed for several mass killings and

when at least seventeen Cuvier's beaked whales are <span class="t6 t10 t15 hoverable">known</span> to have

Post mortem examination showed that sonar killed them
through resonance, a process in which air bubbles in <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> can
amplify sound waves by up to 25 times. When whales dive the air is
forced out of their lungs into the tiny air spaces around the brain.
Harmful resonance in these air spaces is believed to <span class="t1 t3 t9 t15 t20 t21 t26 t29 hoverable">cause</span> massive
tissue damage and hemorrhaging, so that injuries can occur at
<span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> lower sound levels and over a <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> larger area than is
presently acknowledged.
The rules that the US navy scientists follow are based on oldfashioned physical science which puts the safe noise level below 180
decibels, and the safe distance below 2.2 km (1.4 miles). There is
now evidence that resonance effects <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> injure whales up to 100
km (62 miles) away.

Plants have perception and memory
Cleve Backster was a former CIA interrogator who trained police in
the use of the polygraph, or lie detector. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> of their techniques was
the use of 'threat to wellbeing' to evoke emotionality in suspects. In
a spontaneous experiment, he attached the electrodes of the instrument to a plant. In considering what a plant <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> regard as a
threat, he <span class="t0 t5 t6 t14 t18 hoverable">thought</span> of applying a burning match to a leaf. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Without</span>

the plant.6

others.)
Backster's best <span class="t6 t10 t15 hoverable">known</span> experiment excluded the <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> factor.
Live brine shrimps were dumped in boiling <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> automatically
at pre-determined intervals, near the plants which reacted 'emotionally' each <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> the massacre <span class="t4 hoverable">took</span> place. Not only do plants
respond as if they had a nervous system, but they <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> exhibit a
capacity for memory. As we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> later, <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> has this
memory facility. With specially adapted equipment, 'emotional'
reactions have <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> been monitored from amoebas, blood samples and cell cultures. Experimenting with fertilized eggs, it was
<span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> that when <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> egg was broken others, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> in the next
room, responded with shock.
Societies with ancient roots still celebrate this knowledge, as in
the kosher quietening rituals, prior to the <span class="t27 hoverable">sacrifice</span> of animals, or in
the blessing of crops before they are harvested. This is more than
consideration for the sacrifice, for it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> recognizes that the food
thereby retains higher vibrations and is more beneficial for <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span>
consumption.

Cymatics
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> to convert vibration into visible <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> was an eighteenth century German physicist, Ernst Chladni, who <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> he
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> influence patterns of sand scattered on a steel disc by playing
<span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> notes on a violin. This was developed last century by Hans
Jenny of Zurich, using sophisticated equipment with liquids, plastics, metal filings and powders.7 He then vibrated the discs at
ascending pitch, and <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> that the harmonic patterns that
appeared at <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> pitches formed a variety of organic shapes:
spirals of jellyfish turrets, concentric rings of tree growth, tortoiseshell patterns or zebra stripes, pentagonal stars of sea-urchins,
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

hexagonal cells of honeycombs, etc. The higher the frequency, the
more complex the pattern. Jenny <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> produced a stunning film
which shows that raising the pitch of sound caused a static pattern
to change into a moving one.
All of these were, of course, the same geometric and vortical
forms which underlie the ordering of physical matter; <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> 'inorganic' matter vibrated simply with sound produces 'organic' shapes.
But what is intriguing is that the sand collects on the 'dead' areas of
the plate, for the 'life' of the pattern is vibrating on the background
that is free of sand. The paradox is that the visible expression of
energy is the inverse of the actual vibratory pattern, which is invisible. Organic growth and development require harmony. Resonance
is the process by which harmony is <span class="t2 t4 t5 t22 t23 hoverable">brought</span> to lower systems which
then provide a firm basis <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> which higher structures <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> be built.
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> is reminded that the early Christian Gnostics insisted that
the physical <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> is but a shadow or shell of a supreme ordering
energy that exists in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">another</span> dimension. Schauberger <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> saw the
physical <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> a discarded mantle or energetic detritus, the creative energy of the fifth dimension having been spent. Callum Coats
saw the resonant pattern associated with a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> as the seed
bearing the image or idea of what is to be created. He argued that all
physical manifestation develops as the product of focused energy
from the 'Will-to-create' or original 'Source.'

Patterns and shapes
Patterns are to do with order; with design and structure. <span class="t15 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">Nothing</span>
can <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">come</span> into being <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> a design or template. The patterns in
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> are governed by laws that oral tradition tells were the gift of
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">gods</span> (perhaps a rationalization of a chicken-and-egg situation!). Holistic or <span class="t7 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">spiritual</span> science sees <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> as a mirror of the
original creative impulse in the Universe, a manifestation of the
Universal Mind, or The-All-That-Is.
Our science, since the Renaissance, has been searching for
immutable Laws that help to explain how the natural <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> works.
Because the territory it observes is limited to the physical, conventional science rejects the idea of a cosmic <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> that affects the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> and its inhabitants at a subtle energetic level, which frustrated Schauberger. He demonstrated that a <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> science that has
more in common with ancient wisdom does show how the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span>
