is subservient to cosmic laws, creating 'correspondences' between
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> orders.
Until comparatively recent times, scientists and philosophers
recognized the creative energy of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> as sacred. They saw the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> in which Nature's patterns and its complex interdependences
were so often expressed in very specific shapes and numbers as
proof of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> at work. So they <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> these correspondences sacred
numbers and sacred geometry. It is certainly difficult to explain
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">away</span> the complex mathematical and symbolic patterns in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> as
purely accidental or fortuitous (see below, p. 66).

Patterns in motion
In the beginning was the vortex8
All <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> is motion. Natural movement is not in straight lines, but in
spirals, or in spiraling vortices. Spirals are the actual shape of fluid
energy evolving <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> from chaos. Viktor Schauberger saw them as
the natural movement of life, from the structure of galaxies down to
the atom. The spiral is the most common vehicle for 'correspondences' — as above, so below.
The spiral can develop in a number of <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> ways: as a vortex, moving upwards or downwards, round in a circle, or doubling
back on itself. Whenever there is movement, spirals form, visibly
with water; but gases and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> electrical fields express themselves
in spirals or doughnuts. Sinews, tissues, blood and bones and so
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">many</span> formations in organic <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> are spiral in form.9

Rhythms <span class="t5 t7 hoverable">within</span> the solar system
The relationship between <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> and Moon can be very subtle.
Professor Frank Brown of Northwestern University has shown
how the 'biological clocks' that initiate cyclical activities <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> ratrunning, and colour change in fiddler crabs are subject to lunar
rhythms. His better <span class="t6 t10 t15 hoverable">known</span> experiment involved the shipment in
hermetically sealed containers of oysters from the sea shore at
<span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">New</span> Haven, Connecticut to Evanston, Illinois, 2000 miles inland.
<span class="t5 t7 hoverable">Within</span> a couple of weeks they had adjusted the conspicuous
rhythm of opening and closing their shells to the lunar tides that
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> have existed at Evanston had it been on a sea coast.
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

The terrestrial environment is teeming with electromagnetic
phenomena and their secondary effects, which are demonstrably
related to greater events in outer space. Dr Harold Burr of Yale
University kept extensive records of the voltage changes measured in holes bored in the trunks of trees. When both ends of a
wire were inserted into <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> holes vertically a yard apart, an electrical current <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> be detected moving either up or down, at <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> voltages, in regular cycles that were not related to the
Moon's phases, but to some other unidentified non-terrestrial
source. His records showed that all trees, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> hundreds of miles
apart, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> simultaneously experience the same changes of the
voltage and direction of the current. It is as if the <span class="t3 t5 t7 t9 t20 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> family of
trees responds to the same electrical rhythm, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> a cosmic
breathing.10
It seems that there are universal laws, not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> fully understood,
which guide an organism's growth into predetermined patterns. As
the vehicle for creative energy, the spiral is clearly involved in the
organic growth of plants and embryos. Buds contain all the concentrated energy of the future plant, and their mathematical analysis
can yield clues as to how this formative energy is expressed. Rudolf
Steiner, the founder of Anthroposophy, initiated these studies,
which have been developed in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> detail by the projective mathematician Lawrence Edwards.11
Edwards discovered that tree buds expand and contract in a
curious rhythm, specific to the species. He applied Steiner's theory
that a species often has a particular connection to a planet. Steiner
suggested correspondences between particular trees and flowers
and <span class="t3 hoverable">certain</span> planets, for example, the oak with Mars, and the beech
with Saturn. The results clearly showed that these bud pulsations
are linked to the cycles of particular planets. The Moon on its own
had little effect, but when amplified by an alignment with Saturn
(for the beech) and to Mars (in the case of the oak), showed unmistakable fortnightly rhythms. There was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> beech tree studied that
did not show these phenomena. It was <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> to be growing a few
yards from an electricity supply substation!

The confrontation of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> geometric systems
Schauberger was at odds with scientific rationalism. He described
our prevailing Euclidean geometric system as 'techno-academic.' It
4. NATURE'S PATTERNS AND SHAPES

is essentially a controlled, closed system <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whose</span> elements are the
point, the straight line, the circle and the ellipse. This system dominates the contemporary worldview and mindset and is incompatible with Nature.
In more traditional communities, the hard, straight lines of
structures were often softened with decorative embellishments,
such as are still <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> on the eaves or rooflines in some Alpine
villages. In the last century, ornamentation has been stripped
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">away</span> in architectural design and we are left with buildings that
present a naked angularity and sterile uniformity (of agricultural
monoculture).
Until modern times the Chinese rejected the Euclidean model.
Their building designs were informed by geomantic principles that
recognized the straight line as the path of the dragon, the personification of destructive energy. This energy <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> be tamed by making it flow into curves and spirals. The Chinese understood in those
<span class="t0 t3 t4 t5 t11 t20 t26 t27 hoverable">days</span> that straight lines fostered disruptive behaviour. Perhaps it is
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> to consider what a deadening effect the boxes we inhabit <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span>
have on our thoughts and emotions; of how our dependence on the
straight line <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> <span class="t1 t3 t9 t15 t20 t21 t26 t29 hoverable">cause</span> us to behave.
Nature's system is non-Euclidean, open and dynamic; its elements are open spirals forms, shell, egg and vortical forms. This
facilitates a fluid and adaptable environment, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> in which forms
are able to evolve into more complex and creative arrangements.
Other creatures, <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whose</span> sensitivity is nourished by the subtle energies of open forms, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span> use of roundness and curves in their
nests, burrows, and shells. In <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> to arrest the downward spiral
of our culture, we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">take</span> <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t9 t12 t14 t15 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">note</span> of systems that encourage creative change (see Fig. 5.1, p. 78). Schauberger wished that we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span>
remember that we were created as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">part</span> of the organic processes of
Nature, rather than the mechanical processes that we have
adopted.

Sacred geometry
Viktor Schauberger saw patterns and rhythms as the heartbeat of
the Universe, and was fascinated by the traditional use of the language of number and <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> to codify how they are repeated and
in what form. It is hard for us, schooled in a rationalist worldview
which separates <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> from the natural <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> that they are
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

part of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> whole. The ancients regarded mathematics and geometry as the tools to understand patterns in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> and in the Universe. The religious leaders of old, who were <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> the scientists
and mathematicians, did not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span> our mistake of putting <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> phenomena in separate compartments. To them, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> of
matter and reason and the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t3 t5 t7 t8 t13 t16 t18 t20 t21 t25 t27 t29 hoverable">spirit</span> and the awareness of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> were all one. In the context of myth and symbol, they <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span>
numbers and forms in a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> satisfy the <span class="t7 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">spiritual</span> sense
of <span class="t6 t13 t14 t25 t27 hoverable">meaning</span> and the scientific need for structure and reason. Out
of this process arose the traditions of numerology and sacred
geometry.
In all the ancient cultures, the square symbolized the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> of
matter and rationalization, and the circle the encompassing <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span>
of <span class="t0 t1 t3 t5 t7 t8 t13 t16 t18 t20 t21 t25 t27 t29 hoverable">spirit</span> and feeling. How to <span class="t22 hoverable">bring</span> them into balance was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span>
'squaring the circle' and was the pursuit both of architecture and
philosophy. The sum of the sides of the square was equal to the circumference of the circle, so they <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">come</span> into harmony by enclosing
the same area. This is sometimes <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> as a metaphor for the balanced personality. So 'circling the square' indicates someone <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whose</span>
rationality is greater than his/her sense of feeling.
As with other problems in sacred geometry, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> it is not
possible to draw this relationship by simple measurement,
because it is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">part</span> of the natural order, that is where the solution is
to be <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> — in fact in the relationship of the size of the Moon
to the size of the Earth.12 You draw a square around the circle of
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> (each side of which will equal the Earth's diameter).
Then you draw the Moon on the same scale, sitting on top of the
Earth. A circle with its centre as the centre of the Earth, and its circumference passing through the centre of the Moon will have a
circumference equal to the sum of the sides of the square enclosing the Earth.
Fig. 4.2 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> contains the 3-4-5 Pythagorean triangle which
connects the corners of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> and Moon squares. It was from
such relationships that the 'Pythagorean canon of proportions' was
created. The basics of musical harmony depend on intervals created
by these <span class="t0 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">divine</span> proportions. There were canons of architecture, of
painting and of musical harmony taught in the medieval mystery
schools, and partly revived in the Renaissance.

'The Vessel of the Fish' is the simplest and most
informative geometrical symbol, being the orifice
of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> interpenetrating circles which inspired the

rectangle enclosing the vesica.

The golden mean
The search for perfect proportion, a shape for containment that is
aesthetically pleasing, led to the discovery of the 'Golden Mean' or
rectangle. The square is too mechanical, a <span class="t1 t6 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> rectangle too
awkward. The shape that 'seems' to be just <span class="t27 hoverable">right</span> is a square rectangle with the proportions 1:1.618. This turns out to be the magical proportion favoured by <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> in her designs. A <span class="t14 hoverable">series</span> of
these, reducing in size, <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> a perfect spiral, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> the nautilus shell
(Fig. 4.4).
Spiral forms often display a similar 'sacred' proportion of
1:1.618; numbers in the Fibonacci series, for example, which maintains the Golden mean proportions indefinitely, and dictates the
beautiful spirals in a sunflower head, Nature's ingenious <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> of
packing the maximum number of seeds into the head.13 An intriguing <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> that arises in Nature, either on its own, or as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">part</span> of a more
complex form, is the vesica piscis (Fig. 4.3). It is the feminine principle of generation from which spring all other geometrical forms,
from triangles, squares, polygons, to Golden mean rectangles, which
abound in sacred architecture.
All the traditional arts and sciences were based on the same cosmic truths expressed in number, and the sacred numbers were the
ratios in a revealed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> order, drawn from the experience of mystics and confirmed by precise measurements of the solar system.
Sacred buildings from Stonehenge to the Temple of Solomon,

The Middle Ages were a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> when the physical and the <span class="t7 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">spiritual</span> were completely intertwined, but our histories, based on the

<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> of ignorance and deprivation. In fact they were seething
with creativity and inspiration: <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> the Gothic cathedrals which
relied more on an understanding of correct proportion than on
reasoned engineering skills. Medieval musicians were fascinated
that if you divided an open string by <span class="t3 t5 t7 t9 t20 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> numbers, you can get
notes that are in exact proportions.14 They rediscovered the miracles of harmony, and easily accepted them as Divine. This <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span>
be the reason for the extraordinary beauty of medieval chants.

of innovative natural scientists who are able to immerse themselves

theories spontaneously emerge. But his intuition <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> <span class="t22 hoverable">bring</span>

This relationship (proportion) of 5:8 is the signature of the
'Golden Section,' <span class="t6 t10 t15 hoverable">known</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> by the Greek letter phi ( ), which

centre growth point (the radius length being determined by phi),
a large variety of natural spirals and leaf shapes can be created.

How the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">World</span> <span class="t9 t16 t26 hoverable">Works</span>

5. Energy Production
The inefficiency of modern technology
Why are the accepted methods of producing energy so inefficient?
<span class="t6 t9 t18 t26 hoverable">Far</span> more energy in terms of fuel <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> be applied than is produced,
in most cases more than twice. This has up to now not been of concern, as fossil fuels have been regarded as unlimited and free for the
taking, and still are by most, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> there is more discussion now
of sustainability. The main argument for reducing their use is that
their consumption produces CO2, the principal source of global
warming.1 A <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> source is now regarded as unsustainable unless,
as for example with solar panels, it is renewable; it does not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">take</span>
from the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> giving back.
To compare the efficiency of modern technology with that of the
<span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> is illuminating. Walter Schauberger (Viktor's son) calculated that a typical car on a journey of 1000 km (621 miles) consumes as <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> energy as a <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> being uses in a <span class="t3 t5 t7 t9 t20 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> year. In an
11 hour journey, the car has consumed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> being's annual
oxygen requirement. To replenish the oxygen consumed by the
world's motor vehicles annually requires healthy forest covering
28% of the world's <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 hoverable">land</span> area, <span class="t6 t9 t18 t26 hoverable">far</span> more forest than our present, and
dwindling, forest cover.2 There is alarming evidence that the
amount of free oxygen in our atmosphere is actually reducing. This
comes from an analysis of air captured in bubbles in ancient glaciers in Antarctica as <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t8 t10 t12 t13 t14 t17 t19 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">well</span> as in amber.
Using the famous Hasenohrl-Einstein equation E=mc2, Walter
Schauberger calculated that the amount of energy stored in 1 gram of
material substance (e.g. flesh, wood, water) amounts to 25 million
kWh.3 The challenge is how to unlock this source of energy. Viktor
Schauberger once said: 'More energy is encapsulated in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">every</span> drop of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> spring <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> than an average <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> station is able to produce.'4
Schauberger observed that Nature's methods of producing
energy were <span class="t6 t9 t18 t26 hoverable">far</span> more efficient, which led him to design implosion
machines for natural energy production in the belief that they
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> solve the crisis of modern technology.
5. ENERGY PRODUCTION

Entropy and ectropy
James Lovelock proposed in his Gaia hypothesis that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> (for his
mathematical model he <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">name</span> 'Daisyworld') regulates the
Earth's energy balance through natural feedback mechanisms to
suit the evolution of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> forms. All energy <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> by living and nonliving systems eventually degrades to irrecoverable waste heat, or
disorder. All our physical processes lead to entropy. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">made</span> use
of this to create the greenhouse effect, by which increasingly complex <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> forms were introduced into the biosphere as the climate
was gradually modified.5
Entropy or disorder has been recycled by the Earth's greenhouse
effect for millions of years. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Every</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> we walk a pace forward, respiratory processes in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> burn a little ordered carbohydrate to
<span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> the muscles of our legs, and some disordered waste heat has
been lost <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> trace from the surface of the body. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Every</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> a
simple bacterium moves a milli-millimetre it releases a few microcalories of disordered heat waste. But <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">every</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> a jet plane cuts its
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> through the stratosphere it leaves behind a massive amount of
irrecoverable heat that disperses into the planetary heat sink in total
disorder. It is all a question of degree. We are now increasing entropy
to an unsustainable degree that is decimating <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> on the planet.
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> environment provides an extremely narrow temperature range compared to the extremes <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> in the Universe. Growth
and development of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> forms require moderate temperature conditions, as large or abrupt changes are harmful to most organisms.
Our warped technology has <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">made</span> us <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> to very high temperatures; we produce <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> through combustion and hot fission. Most
of our manufacturing processes require excessive heat and high
pressure. We create chemical compounds using the coercion of heat
and pressure. Technical <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> can indeed produce a high degree of
<span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> place, but in so doing he creates a <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> greater amount
of disorder elsewhere.

Scientific 'laws'
Scientific laws are fairly reliable general statements about particular events under specific circumstances. The <span class="t6 hoverable">Second</span> <span class="t0 t8 t12 t15 t19 t23 t25 hoverable">Law</span> of Thermodynamics, for example, which states that all closed systems <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span>
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

generate into chaos <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> input of energy to maintain the ordered
state, is <span class="t0 t5 t6 t14 t18 hoverable">thought</span> to be inviolable. Schauberger, by demonstrating
that energy <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> arise spontaneously in his 'perpetual motion'
machines, or that frictionless movement <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> be achieved, disproved this axiom.
Due to the remarkable feedback systems of the atmosphere and
the biosphere, temperatures on <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> are kept <span class="t5 t7 hoverable">within</span> the narrow
band of those required for abundant life, especially of higher <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>
forms. Gaia research has shown that it is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> itself which has finetuned that thermostat, so that more complex <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> forms are able to
develop. Some species live <span class="t5 t7 hoverable">within</span> small microclimates, so that on <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span>
tree you can find several kinds of finch, each having its own niche.
Humanity is considered to be the most adaptable of species, able
to survive in a range of about -10°C (14°F) to +40°C (104°F). While
that is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> for the species, it is not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> for individuals, unless you
believe that individual physical health and <span class="t7 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">spiritual</span> wellbeing are
stronger than they have <span class="t29 hoverable">ever</span> been. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> of the requirements of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> is that, in <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> to be whole, we have to be in tune with our
environment. It takes <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">many</span> generations of adaptation to a specific
environment for <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> to develop fine physical qualities and sensitive psychic faculties. Similarly it takes generations to adapt safely
to a change in the environment (for instance, as a result of global
warming or microwave radiation). In the past <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> hundred <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t22 t23 t28 hoverable">years</span>
our bodies have been challenged to adapt to higher temperatures
and in the last sixty to stressful microwave energy.
Compare this to the efforts modern humans <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">take</span> to accommodate a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> divorced from Nature, to jet travel <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> and unnatural
food, and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> subject to enormous electromagnetic stress. We <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">take</span>
mountains of pills to counteract physical and emotional imbalances or go to psychotherapists to assuage our <span class="t7 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">spiritual</span> starvation.
While he does not suggest returning to primitive life-styles,
Schauberger assures us that, while our lives are now completely out
of balance, by following Nature's clues we can regain both equilibrium and sanity.

Energy pollution
We usually think of pollution in physical terms, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> a room full of
tobacco smoke, or a factory's chemical effluent poisoning a stream.
This is the boundary for conventional science. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> when <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span>
5. ENERGY PRODUCTION

raise fears about the safety of microwave ovens, radar transmission
towers, mobile phones, the official response from scientists is
inevitably, 'there's no evidence that they are any danger to health.'
Naturally, cynical collusion between government and industry only
strengthens this misguided view in <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> to discourage public
protest or lawsuits.
Viktor Schauberger <span class="t2 t4 t5 t22 t23 hoverable">brought</span> a further dimension to the concept
of energy pollution. He understood that the creative process of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> is consistently to refine, to diversify and produce higher
forms of organic systems — to use a metaphor from <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> experience — to raise consciousness (consciousness as integration of
higher levels of connectedness). He distinguished <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> forms in
which subtle energies perform these upwardly evolutionary functions, which in the last <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">chapter</span> we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> dynagens, fructigens and
qualigens.
They are produced, as we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> in the chapters that follow,
through the specific forms of motion and temperature that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span>
designed for the purpose of evolution. If I were in a court of law, it
is these complex processes that I <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> cite as evidence for meaning, purpose and above all, <span class="t20 hoverable">intelligence</span> in Nature. Schauberger
described these 'enlightened' control systems thirty <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t22 t23 t28 hoverable">years</span> before Jim
Lovelock and his colleagues proposed the Gaia theory of intelligent
self-sustainability in Nature, and in the area of evolutionary energies, <span class="t0 t3 t4 t5 t8 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">went</span> <span class="t6 t9 t18 t26 hoverable">far</span> ahead of them.
The blocking of these creative energies by the emanations from
modern technological processes Schauberger saw as the most dangerous <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of pollution. Their heat, pressure and, above all, chaotic
effects actually destroy the more delicate energies of Nature's constructive developmental processes. Thus, chemicals invading a
stream not only <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span> it dirty and smelly, but they <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> destroy the
complex structure of the water, so that it can no longer behave <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span>
healthy water, but literally dies (see <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span> 11).
This <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of pollution has an evolutionary as <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t8 t10 t12 t13 t14 t17 t19 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">well</span> as a health
effect on people. Schauberger suggested that this explained the welldocumented degeneration of <span class="t20 hoverable">intelligence</span> and the increase of violence in industrial communities. Dr Weston Price, studying fourteen
isolated indigenous communities around the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> in the early
1930s noted this in the effect that changing from their slowly
evolved local diet to a western-type diet had on these <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> (for
food is energy medicine!).6
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

We don't <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">know</span> how <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> energy pollution from anti-Nature
technology affects the environment in general. Logically it should
be most prevalent near <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> stations, large factories and the like.
However, when rivers, which are the arteries of the blood of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> (see <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span> 11), and normally transmit energy to the surrounding countryside, are turned into 'lifeless corpses' (as
Schauberger <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> to say), what effect will this cadaverous energy
have on the environment? Clearly, if humanity is to reverse the
downward devolutionary spiral, our <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> priority <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> be to change
over to Nature's energy systems.

The choice before us
Humanity lived a relatively natural and sustainable lifestyle until
fairly recent times. The growth of industry and its massive demand
for energy resources has introduced increasing degrees of instability. Going back over 2000 years, but <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> more clearly in the last
350 years, it has been possible to chart a <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> kind of development which has <span class="t2 t4 t5 t22 t23 hoverable">brought</span> with it a deterioration of the natural environment, increasing disorder and inefficiency.
Callum Coats shows this divergence of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> systems in the
accompanying chart (Fig. 5.1). In the last 150 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t22 t23 t28 hoverable">years</span> with rapid
industrialization, a scientifically based technology developed, and
the divergence shown by the lower curve has <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> dramatic, with
dire consequences for the environment.
By contrast, the curve rising up toward 'ectropy' shows how natural evolution builds more complex systems with more evolved
species on the foundation of earlier ones. This is how biodiversity
increases. The appearance of <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> species requires a surplus of evolutionary energies deriving from the improved conditions of interdependence. It is as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> the growth in natural capital from the
sound economy of evolution produces interest or surplus energy
from which <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> forms <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> be formed. Nature's system is so
economical that little is wasted. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">many</span> seeds, nuts and fruits
which sustain all the currently existing <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> forms, can be seen as the
surplus on Nature's interest.
The mineral resources of the Earth, which are Nature's base capital, should <span class="t0 t10 t11 t14 t18 hoverable">never</span> be used. As we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> in <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span> 17, Schauberger
illustrates how they are essential building blocks in the production
of formative energies. The indigenous <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> understood their

that they regard as sacred.

The centre line in Fig. 5.1 represents 100% efficiency. This <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span>

decreases. Above all, the purpose of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> is to seek movement,
change and evolution; she despises stasis and uniformity.

Where once rich forest flourished, with a wide diversity of interdependent species of trees and animals, there exist now
only monocultures. This requires enormous, hedgeless fields
where only <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> crop is grown, dependent on fertilizers that slowly
destroy the living humus; they <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> monotonous environmental wastelands. Gone are the high yielding, organically nourished
fields surrounded by windbreaking hedgerows teeming with birds,
small animals and wildflowers. The frequently reported notices of
endangered or newly extinct species bear witness to this ebbing
biodiversity.
What Schauberger calls the 'techno-mechanical economic system' produces a downward curve, accelerating as unnatural systems
of energy are applied more widely. Pollution apart, these systems are
clearly inefficient. In the 1970s, Walter Schauberger discussed
industrial efficiency with Dr Fritz Kortegast, head of research and
development at Mercedes-Benz in Stuttgart, who confirmed that at
that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> the propulsive energy produced by their most sophisticated engines was only 13% of the total energy introduced, the balance consumed as dissipated heat and pollution. A business this
inefficient <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> soon fail.
The <span class="t3 t7 t9 t10 t15 t19 t22 hoverable">truth</span> is that our techno-mechanical economic system is created by vested interests that consume energy through the massive
exploitation of non-renewable resources. It <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> be clear that the
ultimately such unsustainable technology can produce only economic collapse, social chaos and environmental deterioration. The
disorder and decay that we are witnessing <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">come</span> from our dependence on an energy system that is self-destructive. In this system, an
investment of $100 produces $13, which in turn <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> produce only

Energy defines quality
Convinced that we are the pinnacle of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> on the Earth, we humans
are actually destroying the very basis of creativity on the planet. It
is the diversity of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> that supports our <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> in the biosphere.
The ongoing extraction of oil, coal and other minerals, deforestation, overfishing, and the continual loss of animal and plant species
threaten our very existence. It is <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t8 t10 t12 t13 t14 t17 t19 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">well</span> accepted that only inferior
5. ENERGY PRODUCTION

kinds of fish can live in poor quality water. It is no <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> for people. By allowing the natural resources of the environment to depreciate, the quality of <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> potential inevitably suffers.
Conventional science does not understand the importance of
quality. For the reductionist scientist <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> is water, or a genetically
engineered crop is the 'substantial equivalent' of a conventional
crop. No <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">things</span> can be identical in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whose</span> processes
depend on constant change and transformation. While quantitative
science states that 1 + 1 makes 2, no <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> natural systems can <span class="t29 hoverable">ever</span>
be equated.
Monocultures and mass production mean repetition. They
repeat an energetic or experiential process that has already happened, in which no <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> development, no advance, <span class="t27 t28 hoverable">however</span> slight, is
possible. Identical repetition goes against evolution, because it
wastes energy. The development of a <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> natural process or system
demands change and variety.
George Gurdjieff, the Caucasian mystic and teacher, <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> to
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">say</span> that the ordinary <span class="t9 hoverable">person</span> operates <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> a blind machine with
no awareness or consciousness. Viktor Schauberger saw contemporary humans as superficial creatures that look, but <span class="t0 t10 t11 t14 t18 hoverable">never</span> see.
Our seeing is limited to recognition, not deep examination. We
mistake outward appearance for totality, effect for cause. What we
actually <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> are the external shells of manifestation, what is left
by the formative energy. We don't <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> the energy that created the
organism.

The creative energy-vortex

The creative process takes <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> as

wishes. It draws down matter as a mirror image of the idea or
blueprint. This is why the physical is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">said</span> to be the shell of the
organic reality.

in our capillaries, external manifestations of an energy path. We

Viktor Schauberger <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> to describe the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> as a huge dung-heap,

So, physical manifestation depends on the movement of energy.
All of Nature's creations that we observe are the outward shell of
the formative energy path. Schauberger <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">say</span> that a tree will

He demonstrated that the vortex is the natural <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of movement for energy. The accompanying photograph (Fig. 5.3) <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t8 t10 t12 t13 t14 t17 t19 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">well</span> illustrates the spiraling <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> that <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> prefers. Each of the twists is
slightly smaller than the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> above. Viktor's son, Walter, calculated
the mathematics and proportions of this structure.8
Callum Coats <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> the action of our weather to demonstrate the
importance of the vortex in creating material substance. The spiraling air masses possess very little density, very slow rotational velocities and a large radius of influence. When these air masses
converge, they gain in speed with the reduction in their radius of
rotation.

core of some tornados becomes so dense they can bend railway

Viktor Schauberger <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> it hard to understand why science has
not ascribed any fundamental importance to the natural movement
of energy and Nature's systems of spiral movement, which are so
clear, from the scale of a galaxy to that of a DNA molecule. Perhaps
this is because it has been too immersed in the Euclidean elements

A famous professor of logic once pointed out:
We <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> conclude, I think, that there is no room for telepathy
in a materialistic universe. Telepathy is something that ought
not to happen at all, if the materialist theory were true. But it
does happen. So there <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> be something seriously wrong
with the materialist theory, <span class="t27 t28 hoverable">however</span> numerous and imposing
the normal facts which support it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> be.9
Goethe too <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">said</span> of scientists,'Whatever you <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">cannot</span> calculate you do
not think is real.'

HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

6. Motion — the Key to Balance
What we are doing is wrong and contrary to Nature. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> moves in
other ways. She primarily employs drawing (i.e. sucking), energies,
since these are indispensable to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> for the growth and maintenance of life. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> uses pressure energies and explosive forces only
for reducing quality and destruction. The <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t7 t10 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> of atomic physicists is
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> upside down. They <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be more correct if they started with
simple nuclear fusion. They should <span class="t1 t2 t4 t7 t15 t17 t18 t19 hoverable">set</span> about the cold transformation
of hydrogen into helium, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> has done over the millions of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t22 t23 t28 hoverable">years</span>
of Creation. Today's technology has a tiger by the tail, because it splits
the heaviest atoms with the greatest development of heat and an
enormous expenditure of energy.1

We use the wrong <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of motion
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> earth, <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> and air are moved determines whether pathogenic or healthy life-forms <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">come</span> into being. <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">New</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> can arise from
burnt (carbonized) bacterial cultures, but if it is wrongly moved and
processed then its parasitic <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> soon becomes evident. However, if
this culture is placed in soil that has been spared humanity's misguided interference, then its life-force blossoms again immediately.2
Motion and energy are inextricably interlinked. Movement is an
expression of energy, and <span class="t16 t21 hoverable">together</span> with temperature, these are the
cornerstones of Schauberger's Eco-technology. Through his careful
observations and experiments he became aware of the difference
between Nature's <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> of working and the prevailing <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> technology. He realized that the principles under which conventional
technology operates <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> be basically unsound to have produced
such appalling consequences for water, for soil and indeed for all of
life.
Most of us are aware of the effects of chemicals in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> and
on the soil, of the dangers of radioactive waste and biotechnology.
But Schauberger was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> concerned with something <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> more
basically wrong with our technology. Being above all a practical
man, he observed the appalling squandering of resources; why are
6. MOTION — THE KEY TO BALANCE

the internal combustion and steam engines on which our civilization depend not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> 50% efficient? The energy that is not turned
into <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> or motion is wasted and heats up the atmosphere,
adding to the greenhouse effect. From his observations of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">came</span> the answer, which is probably the most important of
Schauberger's discoveries — that we use the wrong <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of
motion.
Our machines and technological processes channel agents such
as air, <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> and other liquids and gases into the type of motion that
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> uses only to decompose and dissolve matter. As a consequence, the air, <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> and other substances are devitalized and
debilitated, affecting their surroundings. The energy produced by
our technology is harmful because, by its very nature, it causes deterioration in the environment through strengthening those energies
that break down structures and degrade quality, while at the same
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> suppressing those that increase quality and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> help plants
and animals to be healthy.
Biodynamic and organic gardeners have commented that they
value Viktor Schauberger's advice on how to treat materials that
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> breaks down for recycling, for these insights have been lacking for this <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of cultivation (see <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span> 17 for more on this topic).
Through its dependence on the decomposing mode of motion
our technology is dangerously affecting the vital biodiversity and
balance of our ecosystems, the stability of our societies, and is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> of
the main causes of human-generated global warming. The <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of
motion on which we depend for building and development is the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span>
that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> uses to destabilize and break down. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> uses <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">another</span>
<span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of motion for creating and rebuilding. It is hardly surprising
then, that our technology is self-destructive and unsustainable.
Our mechanical, technological systems of motion are based on
explosive, outward pushing energies which always meet resistance,
producing heat and friction. This <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of movement goes out at a
tangent, producing the fastest movement at the periphery (as in a
wheel), a <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of motion that is disintegrative, noisy and inefficient,
because so <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> of the energy is dissipated. The effect is to break
apart, to fragment. This is the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> we generate our power; from the
inside to the outside. It is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> centrifugal movement, and is a
process that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> will use only to break down before reassembly
into some other <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> takes <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> (see Fig. 1.2, p. 33).
By contrast, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> uses the opposite, centripetal, <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

motion, moving from the outside to the inside with increasing
velocity, which acts to cool, to condense, to structure; <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span>
going down a plughole. When we talk of something imploding on
itself, there is not the resistance or dissipation of energy that is
<span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> in the explosive process. The reverse takes place, cooling and
condensing. Schauberger <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> this 'constructive' movement.
The centrifugal <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of movement should not be <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span>
'destructive,' because the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">word</span> has such a negative connotation,
and it has its rightful purpose in Nature; instead he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> it'deconstructive.' Viktor Schauberger demonstrated with his remarkable
implosion machines that replicated the in-winding motion of
Nature, that this was the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> to create energy for <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> needs in
the future.
As Schauberger's discovery has such enormous implications for
the future of <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> culture, why has it not been openly debated in
scientific circles? The reasons are two-fold. Firstly, Schauberger,
being persona non grata with the German postwar establishment,
was not granted the oxygen of publicity. Secondly, he was talked of
in postwar Germany as a Nazi collaborator, by association rather
than fact, as his <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t7 t10 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> for the Nazi regime was carried out under
duress. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Though</span> both the Russians and the Americans secretly confiscated his research papers, the Cold War <span class="t0 t3 t4 t5 t11 t20 t26 t27 hoverable">days</span> kept his <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">name</span> in the
shadows. His discoveries have been enthusiastically embraced by
the alternative culture, but as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> have not <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> more widely
known.

The 'original' motion
Viktor Schauberger was always comparing terrestrial laws of
motion to the patterns of movement in the Heavens. He firmly
believed that there existed a 'form originating' motion that was
responsible for the evolutionary dynamics of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> and the Cosmos, generally referring to it as the 'original' motion. The <span class="t3 t5 t7 t9 t20 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> Universe is continually in motion. This movement is in spirals, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">many</span>
spirals <span class="t5 t7 hoverable">within</span> spirals. Galaxies <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">take</span> a spiral form. As we saw in
<span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span> 4, forms in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> very often follow the <span class="t0 t8 t12 t15 t19 t23 t25 hoverable">law</span> 'As Above, so
Below,' implying that there is a Universal language of <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> and
motion. Liquids and gases prefer to move in spirals; likewise energy.
Dowsers find energy spirals in the ground. Energy in the <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> seems to do the same.

Interestingly, the German <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">word</span> — Wirbelsaule — for the

<span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> body, literally <span class="t1 t2 t3 t6 t7 t9 t13 t14 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">means</span> a 'spiral' column. Similarly each
of the vertebrae is referred to as a whirlpool or vortex.
Clearly the Germans have <span class="t1 t6 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> had a completely <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span>

it as a stiff, more or less rigid, physical structure, they
understand it more as an energy path. This has obvious
associations with the Hindu concept of Kundalini, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">name</span>
<span class="t1 t2 t4 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">given</span> to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> serpents that metaphorically dwell at the
