The role of subtle energies in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span>
As you <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> remember from our discussion of energies in <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span>
2, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> our physical existence and ordinary level of consciousness are based in a material third dimensional world, our psyche
and our <span class="t7 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">spiritual</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> can be influenced by energies from the
fourth to the sixth dimensions. Some <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> more than <span class="t1 t7 t13 hoverable">others</span> are
attuned to these immaterial energies. Viktor Schauberger undoubtedly was, as were other visionaries, such as Goethe and Rudolf
Steiner.
Although <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> a third dimensional environment, all
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> and creativity is fundamentally dependent on fourth and fifth
dimensional energies. Viktor Schauberger identified these aspects
of the Sun's fertilizing role (the <span class="t7 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">spiritual</span> driving force of life),
<span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t19 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">according</span> to their <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> purposes in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> (as described in
<span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span> 2). Dynagens generate higher intrinsic energy; fructigens
are those subtle energies that produce greater fertility; qualigens
create greater quality. Schauberger believed that there was no more
powerful <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> to stimulate high quality growth than by seeding
these dynamic energies directly on the soil. As in any area of creativity, the balance of the positive and negative, the male and female
energies are all-important.
The Tibetans, who had a practice to bury so-called 'treasure
vases,' knew <span class="t1 t6 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> ago about the seeding of the soil with immaterial
energies in <span class="t3 hoverable">certain</span> propitious places. Filled with precious stones
and metals, these containers were believed to discharge beneficial
energies that enhanced and protected the environment. The
Tibetans believed that gold and other precious metals were best left
undisturbed in the ground as they help to balance the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> energy,
just as the Hopis and the Australian aborigines regard places with
uranium as sacred.
Schauberger's vision was to create a greater abundance of creative animating energy, of fertility and rising quality. To do this
involved a process that sounds more alchemical than scientific. It

The maturation of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> wine, however, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">take</span> a year or more,

Cold <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t28 t29 hoverable">fire</span>
Viktor Schauberger has described an eerie experience he had with
dynagen ethericities, which in this case produced what is <span class="t6 t10 t15 hoverable">known</span> as
'cold fire,' a strange bioelectric phenomenon:
Over thirty <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t22 t23 t28 hoverable">years</span> ago, walking in a virgin, Alpine forest, I

and a profusion of bright flowers that did not seem to belong
in those surroundings. It was close to a gamecock's courtship
display ground, so I decided to spend the night in this remote
spot, in <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> to witness these fine birds display at daybreak.
Towards midnight, I was roused by a bluish-white flame curling up from the mound and jumped up to extinguish this
incipient forest fire.

again issue from rock fissures and, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> shining dewdrops,
stand on the point of a rock. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Many</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t20 t22 t23 t28 hoverable">years</span> ago a chief forester

Now I began to dig into the hillock with the tip of my

slow decomposition rather than putrefaction takes place. Sick
wild animals are attracted to such places which remain
equally warm or cold in winter and in summer, seeking either
a cure or a painless death. Expressed scientifically, constant
anomaly
states
prevail,
which
permit
decay-free
decomposition. This is why, as a particularly sly <span class="t25 hoverable">old</span> forester
explained, the high clergymen had themselves buried in a
constantly cool church crypt, or why the more common
11. ORGANIC CULTIVATION

priests at least had a little roof built over their graves along
the cemetery wall at the eastern side in <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> to protect them
from rainwater. I realized later that, because of its free oxygen
content, which activates decomposive forces, rainwater
actually promotes decay or rusting.10

Fertilizing energies
Schauberger's buried fermentation chamber is sited so as to be a
meeting <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> for the male seminal energies of the <span class="t0 t8 t11 t14 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">Sun</span> (acting perpendicularly to the Earth) and the female fertilizing energies of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> (acting horizontally at or near the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> surface). The
residues or fallout of their combination result in physical growth. As
Schauberger describes:
Having been created out of the most thoroughly rotted elements
of former life, these emanations are the most natural fertilizers,
which have metamorphosed their erstwhile spatiality (spatial
volume) to such a degree, that they can only manifest themselves as highly dosed (concentrated) energetic matter.11
This is what sustainability is all about. Matter being the energetic
waste products of higher (fourth or fifth dimensional) energies created through heat and light, their reconversion into energies <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span>
them the best possible natural fertilizers. There is virtually no limit
to the charge that can be built up with these energies, as they are
nonspatial.
The fertilizing energies (which <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> be a combination of dynagens, fructigens and qualigens) enter the plant itself through the
root protoplasms, the little sacs or vesicles of proto-water or amniotic fluid attached to the root-tip. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Like</span> dew, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">another</span> <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of protowater formed on the tips of blades of grass during the night and
early morning, these vesicles, too, collapse if exposed to <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> and
heat. This is why the greatest care <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> be <span class="t19 hoverable">taken</span> when replanting
small seedlings or saplings, which should be done only at night in
<span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> to keep injury to a minimum.
Absolutely essential to the plant, these delicate root protoplasms
convert the nutritive energies and the minerals into a <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> that it
can absorb. Viktor Schauberger's sketch (Fig. 17.4) illustrates the
process, which he describes:
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

No plant is actually nourished by dissolved matter, but rather
by the nutritive entities of geospheric origin, 'ascended' in a
fourth dimensional state. These diffuse ethericities can enter
the sap-stream only through the root protoplasms, where they
are fertilized by diffuse oxygenic ethericities. The higher outbirth of this emulsion (ur-procreation) is an ethericity that
belongs to fifth dimension. These concentrations of matterenergy emit negative, hyper-charged emanations in all directions and bind the positively-charged ethericities entering
through the skin or the bark. Some of this emulsion solidifies
and whatever is subsequently manifested, is what we call
'growth.'12
With these natural methods of fertilization there is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">therefore</span> <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span>
that we can do to promote healthy and sustainable growth in agriculture. With this technology we have the ability to restore the soil,
our only source of wholesome food, to its former state of high productivity and fertility, and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> to increase it. These <span class="t1 t2 t3 t6 t7 t9 t13 t14 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">means</span> are not
only <span class="t6 t9 t18 t26 hoverable">far</span> cheaper than the use of harmful artificial fertilizers and
noxious pesticides, but they increase both the quantity and quality
of food. Schauberger held that conversion of agricultural practice to
sustainable organic fertility, forestry to biodiversity and <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span>
resources management to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">take</span> into account Nature's more subtle
processes, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> halt the present deterioration both of the environment and of the <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> condition.
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">First</span> we have to understand how <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> works, and accept her
laws. Schauberger's <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> was devoted to this challenge. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Let</span> us hope
that his <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t7 t10 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> will empower <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> to seek this goal, and to encourage the changes needed to change our materialistically oriented
society. In Schauberger's own words:
A free <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> can grow only from a free Earth. Any <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> that
violate Mother-Earth have no <span class="t27 hoverable">right</span> to a homeland, because
high-quality races <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">cannot</span> survive in soils destroyed by speculation, i.e. because they are divorced of all connection with the
Earth. <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Human</span> societies <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> roots perish. They have to experience the path of decay until, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> unsuitable fertilizers, they
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">give</span> up their stubborn wills and only then will they be allowed
to start again and re-enter the mighty course of evolution.13

The Energy Revolution

18. Harnessing Implosion <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Power</span>
'In the <span class="t3 t5 t7 t9 t20 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> machine there is no straight line and no circle.'
(Viktor Schauberger's comment to a visitor to his workshop in 1936.)
Arthur C. Clarke, the futurologist, recently commented that we were
on the verge of a breakthrough in how we access energy. This was
before the giant aerospace company Boeing of Seattle announced
<span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> research with a practical anti-gravity device developed by the
Russian scientist Evgeny Podkletnov.
The obvious area that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be affected is transport; space
travel <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> suddenly <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> easy. Aircraft <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> carry us swiftly
and silently <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> polluting the atmosphere. Surface transport
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> swift and cheap. Building methods <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> be transformed; it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> help with advances in medicine.
But the principal gain <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be virtually free, unpolluting
energy, which <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> be produced <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> in our own homes. Gone
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be the necessity to be dependent on an expensive national
grid. These changes <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t18 t21 t22 t23 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">might</span> not happen smoothly, because political
and economic <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> revolves around the carbon industry, principally oil, and the utilities. Are these <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> brokers going to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">give</span> up
their control <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> a fight? Additionally our present, morally
bankrupt societies seem always to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">give</span> the military industries <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span>
choice of employing <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> technologies.
Because Podkletnov's invention was inspired by Viktor
Schauberger's research, it <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t18 t21 t22 t23 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">might</span> be interesting to follow how his discovery of anti-gravity <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">came</span> from devices he had developed through
observing Nature.

The beginnings of implosion research
During the 1920s, Viktor Schauberger had <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">made</span> a bit of money (as
<span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t8 t10 t12 t13 t14 t17 t19 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">well</span> as a reputation) by building his revolutionary log flumes. This
enabled him to design a prototype <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> plant to extract energy
directly from air and water, based on the powerful energies he had
identified in Nature. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> experiments he undertook with a
Viennese engineer, Dr Winter, in 1931-32 were inconclusive, and
18. HARNESSING IMPLOSION <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">POWER</span>

made him realize he had to undertake <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> more precise observations of how the trout actually transmutes the energies of the
stream into such powerful forward motion.
The principle of the trout turbine was that air and <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> should
be directed through spiral shaped pipes with a specially shaped
cross section that moved the substance in such a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> as to transform it into a 'living' state. After a <span class="t3 hoverable">certain</span> number of revolutions the
air or <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be induced through a specific corkscrew motion
into a highly energized state, from which the energy <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> be
released. What Schauberger was producing was a reaction at the
atomic level. However, instead of violently compressing atoms in
hydrogen gas to create helium and an energy release, he was able to
twist all the elements <span class="t16 t21 hoverable">together</span> in the quiet, but powerful, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> that
happens in Nature; this was more comparable to atomic 'fusion.'
As we have seen, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> of Viktor's brilliant insights into Nature's
methods was the concept of reciprocity. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Many</span> of Nature's processes
depend on the alternating of complementary, but opposite, forms of
energy, e.g heat and cold, gravity and levitation, electricity and
magnetism, centrifugence and centripetence, both aspects of which
combine to create a wholeness through their synthesizing, reciprocal action. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> he <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> that alternating pressure and suction
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> be employed in this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> on the axis of the machine to produce
a powerful propulsive effect.
This 'biotechnical' fusion created what Schauberger <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> 'diamagnetic' or higher quality substances which had levitational tendencies that were the principal feature of the machines he designed
at the beginning of the war. The first, built by a Berlin company in
1940, disappointed him because of the poor workmanship. So he
moved assembly closer to home, to a Viennese plant where, in an
unscheduled test, his <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> flying saucer-shaped prototype broke
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">away</span> from its anchoring bolts and smashed a hole in the factory's
ceiling. The infuriated owner <span class="t0 t10 t11 t14 t18 hoverable">never</span> forgave Schauberger and was
uncooperative about testing a <span class="t6 hoverable">second</span> model.
The German culture has a reputation for being open to <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span>
ideas. Indeed, a German industrialist who had heard about
Schauberger's strange inventions recommended him to Hitler in
1934. Viktor <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">made</span> a strong impression on the Fuhrer who, after the
interview, requested all assistance be <span class="t1 t2 t4 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">given</span> to his research in fuelless energy production. The scientific establishment resented this
upstart; indeed, the <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t9 t10 t12 t16 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t28 hoverable">father</span> of quantum physics, Max Planck, who
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

had been present at the interview, when asked his opinion of
Schauberger's theories, retorted: 'Science has <span class="t15 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">nothing</span> to do with
Nature.'
Professor Ernst Heinkel, who developed the innovative aircraft
that bore his name, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> heard about Schauberger's revolutionary
<span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> source, and stealing his confidential patent application,
attempted in 1938 to incorporate it into his <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> jet aircraft, the
under-performing HE 280. Heinkel persuaded the patents office to
restrict Schauberger's technology to <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> purification projects, so
that he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be free to develop Schauberger's innovations in his
aircraft research. However, it dawned on him that the conventional
aircraft frame was totally inappropriate for Schauberger's suction
engine. The development in 1940 of Schreiver's 'Flying Top' in
Heinkel's Rostock factory suggests that he had more success when

flying saucer.
In 1943, the Schreiver saucer and its subsequent developments
were moved to a secret location in Czechoslovakia to which
Schauberger was from <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> seconded. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">Word</span> of this <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> 'aircraft' reached Himmler's ears; he was drawn more to unconventional science as a source of <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> weapons development. Viktor's
activities were at that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> highly secret, moving from <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> project
to another, but he was apparently not at that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> <span class="t1 t2 t4 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">given</span> responsibility for research and development. However, in 1943 Himmler
entrusted to the SS the role for developing German secret weapons.
The SS established production facilities for these <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> secret
weapons in giant cave complexes in Poland and Czechoslovakia,
safe from Allied bombs, using prisoners of war as labour. Had these
underground facilities been <span class="t1 t2 t4 t7 t15 t17 t18 t19 hoverable">set</span> up earlier in the war, its outcome
<span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t18 t21 t22 t23 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">might</span> have been different. The level of secrecy was extremely high;
so much, indeed, that at <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> crucial location at the <span class="t7 t10 t15 t25 hoverable">end</span> of the war,
the SS lined up 62 of the scientists and laboratory technicians, and
shot them, to save the secrets of that complex 'free energy' atomic
installation falling into the hands of the approaching Soviet troops.1
The SS decided in 1944 that Schauberger's machines were ready
for production. They drafted him and ordered him, under pain of
death, to employ prisoner engineers from the Mauthausen concentration camp near Linz to develop five projects. In addition to the
high priority flying saucer programme, there was a <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> purifier,
a high voltage generator, an air conditioner and a machine to

The American consortium
Karl Gerchsheimer, initiator of the American consortium that tried
(see p. 13) to extract Schauberger's secrets in 1958, as head of all
civilian administration and logistics had been the most powerful
non-military presence in the U.S. zone of Germany from 1945 to
1950. He was a Bavarian who <span class="t0 t5 t6 t14 t18 hoverable">thought</span> he understood where
Schauberger was coming from — he had read some of Viktor's
papers, and felt he shared the same <span class="t7 hoverable">love</span> of the mountains and their
pure water.
Gerchsheimer formulated a plan with industrialist and financier
Robert Donner to <span class="t22 hoverable">bring</span> Viktor and his <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">son</span> to the U.S. to help
develop radical <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> technology, although by that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span>
Schauberger was in very poor health. In <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">May</span> 1958 the group assembled in a secret hideaway in the Texas desert. There were <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">many</span>

A <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> kind of aircraft?
The Wright Brothers' plane a century ago had wings, a tail fin and
rudders. All our commercial jet aircraft today are built on the same
principles, but are <span class="t6 t9 t18 t26 hoverable">far</span> less fuel efficient, requiring hundreds of times
the energy to push through the atmosphere. More and more <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span>
is expended to counter both the air resistance and the pull of gravity, at quite astronomical costs in terms of materials and development. It was to reduce the force of gravity that some of the large
aerospace companies in the U.S.A. were undertaking research in the
early 1950s. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> researcher, Townsend T. Brown had designed a
saucer-shaped craft <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whose</span> weight was significantly reduced by
energizing the skins with massive amounts of electricity and which
happened <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span> the craft invisible to radar.
Conventional scientific theory states that <span class="t3 hoverable">certain</span> laws are inviolable, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> the <span class="t6 hoverable">Second</span> <span class="t0 t8 t12 t15 t19 t23 t25 hoverable">Law</span> of Thermodynamics, Einstein's Theory of
Relativity or the <span class="t0 t8 t12 t15 t19 t23 t25 hoverable">Law</span> of Gravity. We learn this at school, and anyone
who claims otherwise is treated with suspicion or derision.
Researchers now working at the frontiers of science, such as in
quantum physics, are discovering that these laws apply only under
conventional physical conditions, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> this is not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> widely
accepted.

cancelled has profound implications for humanity. It is as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span>
we can add <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">another</span> dimension to our world, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> that had always

It <span class="t0 t10 t11 t14 t18 hoverable">never</span> happened; or did it? All discussion about anti-gravity

have been built at a cost of $20 billion each.2

The aerospace and defense industry <span class="t1 t7 t9 t14 t15 t17 t25 t28 hoverable">says</span> it likes <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who think out
of the box, because they're the guys who <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">give</span> us the breakthroughs ... radar, the bomb, stealth and all that; but think
this <span class="t6 t9 t18 t26 hoverable">far</span> out and they look at you <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> you're crazy. They <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t18 t21 t22 t23 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">might</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> <span class="t0 t2 t16 t18 t21 t22 t23 hoverable">put</span> you away.4
The other, often overlooked, reason for conservatism in technology is the extent to which political and economic <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> is centred partly in transportation, but especially in the carbon fuel
industry. As <span class="t1 t6 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> as there is plenty of oil to be pumped, why risk
destabilization of this <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> by investigating virtually free
energy sources that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> inevitably <span class="t22 hoverable">bring</span> with it <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> more
freedom for countless millions of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who are currently
dependent on the expensive central distribution of oil products
and electricity?

Schauberger's search for free energy
However, in July 2002 Jane's Defence Weekly announced that they
had seen secret research papers from Boeing, the aerospace giants,
confirming positive development of a Russian device — which
comprises rapidly spinning superconducting ceramic discs suspended in the magnetic field of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> electric coils enclosed in a low
temperature vessel.

The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> behind this research is Dr Evgeny Podkletnov, a Russian
scientist then working in Finland. When he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> published details of
his anti-gravity device in 1996, he was ostracized by his colleagues
and then fired by his university, for the <span class="t0 t8 t12 t15 t19 t23 t25 hoverable">Law</span> of Gravity is inviolable!
He subsequently admitted that his father, a leading authority in
hydro-engineering, had acquired original Schauberger papers at the
<span class="t7 t10 t15 t25 hoverable">end</span> of the war.
The most creative pioneers of <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> scientific vision are essentially practical <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who have an urgent need to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> their ideas
<span class="t0 t2 t16 t18 t21 t22 t23 hoverable">put</span> into practice. Viktor Schauberger was no exception. Realizing
that the machines our technology has developed are not only very
inefficient, but that they are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> largely responsible for the destruction of our environment, he <span class="t1 t2 t4 t7 t15 t17 t18 t19 hoverable">set</span> about designing appliances which
<span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> Nature's creative methods, but which were capable <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> of producing vastly more <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> at little cost.
Schauberger abandoned the Euclidean model of straight line
and circle. All the functional surfaces of his machines employ the
spirals, sinuosity and curves of the open forms of non-Euclidean
geometry that are <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> in Nature. The egg-shapes and spirals that
he employed produced life-affirming energies that stabilize,
enhance and rehabilitate natural processes.
When Schauberger designed his prototype machines it was
extremely difficult to perfect complex curvilinear surfaces. Now,
with computer programmes, it is possible with ease to replicate
Nature's eggs, spirals and vortices. A design breakthrough to
designing benevolent systems <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be theoretically simple; what
is lacking is the insight and the imagination.
During the 1930s and 1940s, he developed a number of prototypes: of a machine which produced high quality spring water, a
domestic air conditioning appliance, and various machines which
produced prodigious amounts of motive power. All these machines
worked on <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> the same principles, and had in common a virtually silent and inexpensive operation. All the important elements of
Nature's repertoire <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">come</span> into their own, such as male and female
ethericities, creative vortical movement, temperature gradients,
bioelectricism and biomagnetism. As Schauberger commented: At
the intersection of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> temperature gradients atomic energy is
released. Whether it is a formative or destructive energy is determined in each case by the type of movement and the composition
of the alloys <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> to build the motion-producing machine.'5

The biological vacuum
I can generate suctional forces which act indirectly and are entirely
undetectable. No current of air can be noticed; only an almost imperceptible cooling, as occurs when air is sucked in strongly with the back
of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t29 hoverable">hand</span> held in front of the mouth. It is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">therefore</span> incorrect to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">say</span>
that I have copied the cyclones and typhoons of the tropics.6
The mechanical principle of all of Schauberger s machines is that of
suction, the simplest <span class="t6 t7 t8 t9 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t28 t29 hoverable">form</span> of which we experience when we <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span>
our <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t29 hoverable">hand</span> over the plug hole in a bath of deep water; taking it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">away</span>
and replacing it illustrates the enormous <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of suction. Professor Felix Ehrenhaft, who helped Viktor with his calculations,
worked out that the <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of suction, or implosion as it is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> in
energy terms, is 127 times more powerful than explosion.
Bathtub suction is powered by gravity, which is related to centrifugence, the complement to centripetence. In a similar <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> that the aircraft jet engine uses the interaction of suction and pressure on a
common axis, Schauberger <span class="t27 hoverable">used</span> the balance between centrifugence
and centripetence on a common axis to produce a biological vacuum.
This is created by spinning the gas or liquid at high speed in a
vortical manner so that it becomes dense and cool. If <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> were
used, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">every</span> 1°C of cooling <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> reduce the volume of the gases
contained in the <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> by 1/273. However, if air containing an average amount of <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> vapour is used, the amount of compaction of
air to <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> is in the ratio of 816 to 1. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> litre of <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> at +4°C
(39°F) weighs 1kg, compared to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> litre of normal air which
weighs 0.001226kg. This is the basis of implosion energy.
In 1939 the American airship the Akron was destroyed when its
helium mysteriously reverted to water, reducing in volume 1800fold in a massive implosion. This immense reduction in volume creates a biological vacuum that can be an ideal and environmentally
harmless source of motive power. Gases are converted into <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span>
and those contained in the <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> are further transformed into
energy in the process of continuous cooling which occurs in the formation of a biological vacuum.
Viktor's machines, besides spatially reducing physical matter,
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> converted it into immaterial energies, in reality a translation
from the third to the fourth or fifth dimensions. Callum Coats writes:

Nuclear fusion
The dichotomy between centrifugal and centripetal technologies is
<span class="t0 t10 t11 t14 t18 hoverable">never</span> clearer than with nuclear energy. Viktor frequently inveighed
against the dangers of nuclear fission (explosive), and he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">came</span> near
to the unveiling the secrets of nuclear fusion (implosive), the
Shangri-la of our technical age. The key to it was the extreme biological vacuum, achieved most nearly in his 'flying saucer,'
described later. The process can be described as 'cold fusion.'
Walter Schauberger, with his physics and mathematical background was able to describe the process of conversion of matter into
'virtual' states in a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> that other scientists <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> understand; in
this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> the approaches of <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t9 t10 t12 t16 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t28 hoverable">father</span> and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">son</span> complemented each
other. Richard St Barbe Baker, the prominent environmentalist and
founder of 'The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Men</span> of the Trees' movement, impressed with the

potential of the Schauberger physics tried, sadly <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> success, to

Instead, Baker <span class="t2 t4 t5 t22 t23 hoverable">brought</span> Walter to England in 1950 to lecture to

polite interest, but refrained from comment. However, at Cambridge

was most impressed with Walter, introducing him to other atomic

A group of top atomic physicists at Birmingham showed lively
interest in this <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> physics, and admitted to being inspired. A few
weeks later Baker was again in Birmingham, and asked the scientists if they had held a postmortem on Schauberger's presentation.
'Yes, indeed,' they admitted; they had decided that it was 'unchallengeable.' 'Then what are you going to do about it?' asked Baker.
'Nothing,' was their retort.'Why not?' 'Because it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> mean rewriting all the textbooks in the world.'10

The repulsator
Viktor started <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t7 t10 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> on this machine (Fig. 18.2) early in the 1930s.
It was designed to convert degenerated or distilled <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> into invigorating fresh <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> with the qualities of a mountain spring. A 10litre egg-shaped vessel <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">made</span> of copper, with some active surfaces
silver-plated, was used, insulated to retain the biomagnetic and bioelectrical energies. A powered impeller near the pointed base created alternating <span class="t27 hoverable">right</span> and left handed vortices in the <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> body,
duplicating the negatively and positively charged longitudinal vortices at the bends of naturally flowing rivers. It was inevitable that
for his energy-generating machines Viktor Schauberger <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span>
choose the egg as it is the only closed shape that will naturally generate vortical movement.
The in-rolling and out-rolling movement allows the <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> to
absorb carbon dioxide and various trace elements that are added in
a specific <span class="t0 t6 t7 t8 t11 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">order</span> to approximate the chemical composition of mountain spring water. Some four litres of <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> are drained off while carbon dioxide is introduced. Once the motor has been started, the
carbon dioxide is absorbed into the water. Through the vortical
action and resultant cooling, it is changed into carbonic acid, which
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

creates a vacuum. When the <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> has cooled down to 4°C (39°F),
cold oxidation takes place, allowing the assimilation of the trace elements and minerals.
The process takes three-quarters of an hour, and the <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> is
then left to stand in a cold temperature for 24 hours. The water,
when sipped slowly straight from the egg at a temperature of not
more than 8°C (46°F) will neutralize any over-acidity in the body,
allowing the cells, by taking up oxygen (which is passive at this temperature), to return to health.

The implosion motor
This ambitious machine was designed as an electric <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> generator, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> it did <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> produce high quality water. It worked on the
same principle as the Repulsator, being <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> filled to exclude air and
then drained sufficiently to allow the simultaneous introduction of
carbon dioxide.
It was difficult to build, being dependent on a <span class="t14 hoverable">series</span> of identical
whorl pipe <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> jets conceived to replicate the shape of a Kudu
antelope horn. This intriguingly shaped tube, which has an eggshaped cross section, allows an almost perfect hyperbolic double
spiral flow to manifest. The shape of the pipe and reducing diameter follow the proportions of the Golden section (see p. 69).
This configuration operates in the same <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> as Viktor's pipe in
the Stuttgart experiment, where the shape of the pipe directed the
<span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> in an involuting flow <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">away</span> from the pipe walls, significantly
reducing the friction. In the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> forms of whorl-pipe shown in the
diagram (see Fig. 18.1), the <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> rotates either in the same direction
as the spiral twist of the pipe, or in the opposite direction, depending on which whorl-pipe is selected, the hydraulic efficiency of either
being determined by experiment. In practice only <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> or other of the
whorl-pipe configurations <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be attached to the central hub.
This centrifugal/centripetal effect creates a double spiral motion
to the water, cooling and condensing it; it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> allows the energies to
change polarities, eg from magnetic to bioelectric or from electric
to biomagnetic. This change of polarities <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> convert resistanceproducing energies into motion-enhancing ones, such as levitational and diamagnetic dynagens.
When the centripulser is rotated by the motor at 1200 revolutions
per minute, the <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> is centrifuged down the whorl pipes while

is about l,290m/sec, (four times the speed of sound), which makes
it as solid and hard as steel wire.
The following is the eye-witness report of Gretl Schneider, who
accompanied Arnold Hohl, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> of Viktor's observers:
Mr Viktor Schauberger has demonstrated the machine to me.
The previous huge construction is no more. It has been
reduced to half its former size and in operation develops enormous power. I poured a pot of <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> into the bottom of it. The
machine produced an almost inaudible sound and then a 'pfff
in the same instant and the <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> pierced <span class="t27 hoverable">right</span> through a 4cm
thick concrete slab and a 4mm thick super-hardened steel <span class="t14 hoverable">plate</span>
with such force that the water-particles, invisible to the eye due
to their high velocity, penetrated <span class="t27 hoverable">right</span> through all clothing and
were experienced as lightning needle-pricks on the skin. <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Water</span>
glass was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> passed through and solidified in 5cm <span class="t1 t6 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> hairs
on the outside of the casing, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> bristles.11
Some of Viktor's machines did not need a starting motor, and
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> get going on their own with a few cranks of a manual starting handle. The heavy centripulser perhaps required one, but after
gaining sufficient speed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> produce sufficient energy to selfrotate. If the machine <span class="t9 t16 t26 hoverable">works</span> as Viktor claimed, the generator
should produce ten times more <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> than the motor needs, or a
ninefold surplus of electric current. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> of the problems with Viktor's machines was more how to stop them than getting them
started. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t21 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Another</span> was keeping the machine anchored to the floor to
stop the strong levitational energies that were generated from lifting it into the air.

The repulsine and the flying saucer
As we described in <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">Chapter</span> 1, there were several models of this
machine developed, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> in 1940 to investigate free energy production, later to validate Viktor's theories about levitational flight,
but in the mid-1940s as prototypes of a <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> secret weapon of the
Third Reich:
HIDDEN <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">NATURE</span>

There are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">many</span> rumours about what Schauberger was actually doing during this period, most of which suggest that he
was in charge of developing 'flying discs' under contract to the
army. It later <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> <span class="t6 t10 t15 hoverable">known</span> that 'the 'flying disc' launched in
Prague on the 19th of February 1945, which rose to an altitude of 15,000 metres in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> minutes and attained a forward speed of 2,200 kph, was a development of the prototype
he built at Mauthausen concentration camp. Schauberger
wrote, 'I <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> heard of this event only after the war through
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> of the technicians who had worked with me.' In a letter to
a friend, dated the 2nd August 1956, Schauberger commented,'The machine was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">said</span> to have been destroyed just
before the <span class="t7 t10 t15 t25 hoverable">end</span> of the war on [Field Marshal] Keitel's orders.'12
This was a <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> larger version of a 20cm diameter <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> that Viktor
built at the Schloss Schonbrunn which was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> the Repulsine. It
contained a small high speed electric motor capable of producing
up to 20,000rpm at which point the auto-rotation of the centripulser was initiated. 'This machine generated such a powerful
levitational force, that when it was started (in Viktor's absence), it
sheared the six quarter-inch diameter high-tensile steel anchor
bolts and shot upwards to smash against the roof of the hangar.'13
There were in fact <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> <span class="t1 t2 t18 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">different</span> types of the Repulsine. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">One</span> was
secured to the ground and designed to produce <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> by <span class="t1 t2 t3 t6 t7 t9 t13 t14 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">means</span> of
a horizontal shaft; the other to fly. Both produced strong levitational
energy — hence the <span class="t6 hoverable">second</span> anecdote above.
As the velocities produced by the centripulsing process increase,
the air molecules <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> cooler and more condensed through the
interaction of both centripetral and centrifugal forces. The reduction in volume <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">may</span> reach 1/816, when air is converted into water,
and produces a powerful vacuum inside that rapidly draws in larger
amounts of air, creating a secondary vacuum above the saucer. The
extreme centripulsion and densation not only produce an antigravity effect, but <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> raise the energy level beyond the physical, so that
the electrons and protons are compressed back into their fourth
dimension origins.
All of these actions contribute to the levitational affect, enhancing the principal upwards force provided by the densely compressed atoms passing through the aerofoil slits of the turbine
blades ('t') before being thrust out between the outer cowl ('A') and

Callum Coats in his fourth volume of the Eco-Technology series,
Energy Evolution, brings <span class="t16 t21 hoverable">together</span> Viktor Schauberger s notes, comments and discussions that have survived the appropriation of the
Soviet and American authorities. In that fascinating volume the
machines discussed are the Air-turbine machine, Water-driven and
Air-driven implosion machines, the Repulsator, the Klimator and the
Repulsine. Sadly, the <span class="t2 t7 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t20 t24 t29 hoverable">text</span> often refers to sketches that are missing.
The Air-turbine machine created an artificial thunderstorm,
operating on the principle of the tornado. Schauberger envisaged
this as a fuel-less silent engine to <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> an aircraft by creating a
vacuum in front to pull it forward. The <span class="t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Water</span> and Air-driven implosion machines operated on the principle of a powerful vacuum; he
designed a submarine using a water-driven implosion motor. The
Klimator was a cooling or heating machine designed for domestic
air conditioning.
There is no doubt that Viktor Schauberger produced a number
of impressive and highly innovative machines for various purposes,
and we have eye witness accounts of the operation of some, as <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t8 t10 t12 t13 t14 t17 t19 t23 t25 t28 hoverable">well</span>
as some of his notes. However, any prototypes or working models
were either destroyed in Germany during the war, or were expropriated from his flat by the Russians who <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">first</span> occupied Vienna, or confiscated by the Americans when they overran the Leonstein <span class="t9 t16 t26 hoverable">works</span>
at war's end, or by the Donner-Gerchsheimer consortium, who spirited him <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">away</span> to Texas in their ill-fated attempt to acquire his secret
knowledge.
In the meantime it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">must</span> be noted that there is no proof that any
of them reliably produced over a significant period the <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> that
was intended.
There are a number of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> in America and Australia working
on Schauberger s ideas, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> the political climate has repressed
development of their work. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Let</span> us hope that if these conditions
improve, we <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t18 t21 t22 t23 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">might</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> modifications of some of Viktor's machines
making their appearance. We <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> be examining in the next <span class="t12 t19 t25 t26 t28 hoverable">chapter</span> some of the <span class="t0 t1 t5 t6 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">new</span> initiatives that have been inspired by Viktor's
research.
The tragedy of Viktor Schauberger's <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> was of being born into a
society with little interest in his dream of helping humanity <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span>
empowered and free. Instead, to his intense sadness and heartache

he <span class="t0 t16 t25 t28 hoverable">found</span> his inspired vision of working with <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> twisted towards

American science <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">take</span> seriously someone with no education in science. Viktor Schauberger was hardly <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> to be considered as a contender for the stakes of space-age innovation. He merely
observed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> and talked about fish swimming in mountain
streams, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> he was the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">one</span> who cracked the anti-gravity challenge.
As he himself remarked:
Implosion is no invention in the conventional sense, but
rather the renaissance of ancient knowledge, lost over the
course of time.15

19. Viktor Schauberger and Society
The <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> legacy
We have been concerned in this study so <span class="t6 t9 t18 t26 hoverable">far</span> to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">give</span> an overview of
Schauberger's insights into how <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> <span class="t9 t16 t26 hoverable">works</span> at the subtle level.
Viktor <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">also</span> had strong views on where our society has gone wrong
and where we <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t18 t21 t22 t23 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">might</span> start to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">make</span> changes. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">First</span> we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> seek
insights on the <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> level and, later, we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">shall</span> mention some ongoing developments and research inspired by Viktor's work.
Viktor was a natural scientist and visionary who challenged the
very worldview of a culture that considers itself to be at the apex of
<span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span> achievement. His is not a political view, nor a particularly
moral one. He was continually exasperated by the literal blindness
of those in power, their inability to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> what was before their very
eyes.1
Viktor Schauberger's observations and vision have <span class="t1 t2 t4 t7 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">given</span> us the
keys to disentangling the environmental mess we have got ourselves
into. His insights were not limited to technology and how we do
things, but to all of life. If we were able to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">see</span> that our education,
social organization, philosophy, religions, medicine and science
were all based on seeing only a part-world, we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> have a sense
of how <span class="t0 t1 t5 t10 t12 t13 t15 t19 t20 t28 hoverable">much</span> more exciting and fulfilling <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> be on this wonderful planet, if we <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">could</span> escape from our materialistic worldview
and accept our <span class="t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> on Nature's interconnected plane.
But, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">like</span> the crowd in Hans Andersen's tale going along with the
naked Emperor's fantasies, we are all accomplices in this tragic charade. Schauberger <span class="t0 t2 t16 t18 t21 t22 t23 hoverable">put</span> it forcefully:
If humanity does not soon <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">come</span> to its senses, and realize
that it has been misled and misinformed by its intellectual

will reliably act to <span class="t22 hoverable">bring</span> about a fitting <span class="t7 t10 t15 t25 hoverable">end</span> to this ineptly
contrived culture. Unfortunately, the most frightful catastrophes or scandalous disclosures will have to happen before
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> <span class="t8 t13 hoverable">become</span> aware that it is their own mistakes that have
led to their undoing. These can be rectified only with <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>

difficulty, precisely because it was those in <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> principally
who committed them. Rather than question themselves,
these institutions and individuals, <span class="t29 hoverable">ever</span> protective of their
own interests, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> allow millions of their fellow <span class="t1 t2 t4 t6 t7 t11 t12 t13 t14 t18 t19 t20 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">human</span>

A host of so-called experts is lined up against any
systematic attempt to correct these errors. They are obliged to
advocate the course they have championed, because it is their
livelihood and they wish to be looked after until the <span class="t7 t10 t15 t25 hoverable">end</span> of

Yet, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">even</span> this obstacle <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t18 t21 t22 t23 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">might</span> be overcome if the

industry. A thorough analysis of the most common mistakes
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">made</span> over the centuries reveals the enormous extent of the
